Key Match Events: Justyn-Henry Malloyâ€™s eighth-inning sacrifice fly helped the Tigers rally from a 3-0 deficit.
Riley Greene singled off Garrett Cleavinger, and Matt Vierling drew a walk, setting up the Tigers' comeback.
Colt Keith tied the game with an RBI single, bringing up Malloy to pinch hit.
Malloy lifted a fly ball to medium center for the winning sacrifice fly.
Beau Brieske (4-4) got the win with two innings of relief.
Jason Foley pitched the ninth for his 27th save.
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit, who have won five straight, entered the game tied with Kansas City for the second and third American League wildcard spots, two games ahead of the Minnesota Twins.
Post-Match Reflections: Beau Brieske (4-4) got the win with two innings of relief.
Jason Foley pitched the ninth for his 27th save.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers trailed 3-0 but managed to tie the game and ultimately win.
